alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and Southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Clay and Greene. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Piggott, Campbell, Rector, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Oak Grove Heights, Lafe, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, McDougal, Saint Francis, Glennonville, Beech Grove, Crockett, Hickoria, Tipperary, Knob, Stonewall, Gainesville and Stanford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
